account_required_text: An account is required to play the game
info_registration_text: If you haven't registered yet, you can do so quickly and easily at the link above.
info_login_text: If you are already registered, you only need to log in.
register_checkform_text: To complete the Registration, you must accept the
register_accept_ua: I accept the Terms of Use
register_email_req: Please enter a valid email address
notify_register_checkbox_text: You need to check the checkbox
notify_register_input_empty: You did not fill in all the fields
notify_register_username_length: Username length must be minimum 4 and maximum 15 characters long
notify_register_password_length: Password length must be minimum 6 and maximum 30 characters long
login_failed_empty: Username or Password field is empty
login_user_not_found: The username or password you entered is incorrect
profile_stat_arena_desc: All your victories in Arena game mode
profile_stat_online_desc: All your victories in Multiplayer game mode
profile_xpbar_text: points needed to reach the next level
pokemon_desc_bulbasaur: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
pokemon_desc_ivysaur: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
pokemon_desc_venusaur: It's plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
pokemon_desc_charmander: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
pokemon_desc_charmaleon: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
pokemon_desc_charizard: It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.
pokemon_desc_squirtle: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
pokemon_desc_wartortle: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
pokemon_desc_blastoise: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
pokemon_desc_caterpie: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
pokemon_desc_metapod: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
pokemon_desc_butterfree: It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
pokemon_desc_weedle: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
pokemon_desc_kakuna: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
pokemon_desc_beedrill: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
pokemon_desc_pidgey: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
pokemon_desc_pidgeotto: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
pokemon_desc_pidgeot: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
pokemon_desc_rattata: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
pokemon_desc_raticate: It's hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
pokemon_desc_spearow: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
pokemon_desc_fearow: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.
pokemon_desc_ekans: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
pokemon_desc_arbok: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
pokemon_desc_pikachu: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
pokemon_desc_raichu: It's tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
pokemon_desc_sandshrew: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
pokemon_desc_sandslash: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.
pokemon_desc_nidoran_female: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
pokemon_desc_nidorina: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.
pokemon_desc_nidoqueen: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
pokemon_desc_nidoran_male: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
pokemon_desc_nidorino: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
pokemon_desc_nidoking: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
pokemon_desc_clefairy: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
pokemon_desc_clefable: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
pokemon_desc_vulpix: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
pokemon_desc_ninetales: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
pokemon_desc_jigglypuff: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
pokemon_desc_wigglytuff: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
pokemon_desc_zubat: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
pokemon_desc_golbat: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
pokemon_desc_oddish: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
pokemon_desc_gloom: It's pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
pokemon_desc_vileplume: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokemon_desc_paras: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
pokemon_desc_parasect: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
pokemon_desc_venonat: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.
pokemon_desc_venomoth: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
pokemon_desc_diglett: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
pokemon_desc_dugtrio: It's three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
pokemon_desc_meowth: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
pokemon_desc_persian: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
pokemon_desc_psyduck: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
pokemon_desc_golduck: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
pokemon_desc_mankey: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
pokemon_desc_primeape: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
pokemon_desc_growlithe: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
pokemon_desc_arcanine: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.
pokemon_desc_poliwag: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
pokemon_desc_poliwhirl: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
pokemon_desc_poliwrath: It's body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
pokemon_desc_abra: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
pokemon_desc_kadabra: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
pokemon_desc_alakazam: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
pokemon_desc_machop: It's whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
pokemon_desc_machoke: It's muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokemon_desc_machamp: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
pokemon_desc_bellsprout: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
pokemon_desc_weepinbell: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
pokemon_desc_victreebel: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
pokemon_desc_tentacool: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
pokemon_desc_tentacruel: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
pokemon_desc_geodude: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
pokemon_desc_graveler: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
pokemon_desc_golem: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.
pokemon_desc_ponyta: About an hour after birth, Ponyta’s fiery mane and tail grow out, giving the Pokémon an impressive appearance.
pokemon_desc_rapidash: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
pokemon_desc_slowpoke: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
pokemon_desc_slowbro: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
pokemon_desc_magnemite: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
pokemon_desc_magneton: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
pokemon_desc_farfetch_d: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
pokemon_desc_doduo: It's short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
pokemon_desc_dodrio: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
pokemon_desc_seel: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_dewgong: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
pokemon_desc_grimer: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
pokemon_desc_muk: It’s thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
pokemon_desc_shellder: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
pokemon_desc_cloyster: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
pokemon_desc_gastly: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
pokemon_desc_haunter: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
pokemon_desc_gengar: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey’s shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
pokemon_desc_onix: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
pokemon_desc_drowzee: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.
pokemon_desc_hypno: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
pokemon_desc_krabby: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
pokemon_desc_kingler: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.
pokemon_desc_voltorb: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
pokemon_desc_electrode: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
pokemon_desc_exeggcute: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
pokemon_desc_exeggutor: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.
pokemon_desc_cubone: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
pokemon_desc_marowak: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
pokemon_desc_hitmonlee: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
pokemon_desc_hitmonchan: It's punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
pokemon_desc_lickitung: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
pokemon_desc_koffing: It's body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
pokemon_desc_weezing: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
pokemon_desc_rhyhorn: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
pokemon_desc_rhydon: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokemon_desc_chansey: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokemon_desc_tangela: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
pokemon_desc_kangaskhan: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
pokemon_desc_horsea: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
pokemon_desc_seadra: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
pokemon_desc_goldeen: It's dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
pokemon_desc_seaking: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokemon_desc_staryu: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
pokemon_desc_starmie: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
pokemon_desc_mr_mime: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
pokemon_desc_scyther: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokemon_desc_jynx: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
pokemon_desc_electabuzz: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
pokemon_desc_magmar: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
pokemon_desc_pinsir: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
pokemon_desc_tauros: Once it takes aim at its prey, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokemon_desc_magikarp: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
pokemon_desc_gyarados: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
pokemon_desc_lapras: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
pokemon_desc_ditto: It's transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.
pokemon_desc_eevee: It's ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.
pokemon_desc_vaporeon: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.
pokemon_desc_jolteon: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
pokemon_desc_flareon: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon_desc_porygon: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
pokemon_desc_omanyte: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
pokemon_desc_omastar: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
pokemon_desc_kabuto: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
pokemon_desc_kabutops: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
pokemon_desc_aerodactyl: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
pokemon_desc_snorlax: It's stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
pokemon_desc_articuno: This legendary bird Pokémon can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.
pokemon_desc_zapdos: This legendary Pokémon is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.
pokemon_desc_moltres: It is one of the legendary bird Pokémon. Its appearance is said to indicate the coming of spring.
pokemon_desc_dratini: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
pokemon_desc_dragonair: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
pokemon_desc_dragonite: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
pokemon_desc_mewtwo: It's DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
pokemon_desc_mew: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
pokemon_desc_chikorita: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
pokemon_desc_bayleef: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
pokemon_desc_meganium: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
pokemon_desc_cyndaquil: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
pokemon_desc_quilava: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
pokemon_desc_typhlosion: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.
pokemon_desc_totodile: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
pokemon_desc_croconaw: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
pokemon_desc_feraligatr: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
pokemon_desc_sentret: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
pokemon_desc_furret: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
pokemon_desc_hoothoot: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokemon_desc_noctowl: It's eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
pokemon_desc_ledyba: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.
pokemon_desc_ledian: It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.
pokemon_desc_spinarak: With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy webs that won’t break even if you set a rock on them.
pokemon_desc_ariados: Every night, it wanders around in search of prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing threads before it bites into them with its fangs.
pokemon_desc_crobat: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.
pokemon_desc_chinchou: It's antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
pokemon_desc_lanturn: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokemon_desc_pichu: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.
pokemon_desc_cleffa: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
pokemon_desc_igglybuff: It's body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.
pokemon_desc_togepi: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokemon_desc_togetic: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokemon_desc_natu: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
pokemon_desc_xatu: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokemon_desc_mareep: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
pokemon_desc_flaaffy: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokemon_desc_ampharos: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
pokemon_desc_bellossom: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokemon_desc_marill: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
pokemon_desc_azumarill: It's long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
pokemon_desc_sudowoodo: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
pokemon_desc_politoed: At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.
pokemon_desc_hoppip: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.
pokemon_desc_skiploom: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon’s head.
pokemon_desc_jumpluff: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
pokemon_desc_aipom: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.
pokemon_desc_sunkern: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing it’s weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.
pokemon_desc_sunflora: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
pokemon_desc_yanma: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
pokemon_desc_wooper: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
pokemon_desc_quagsire: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.
pokemon_desc_espeon: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.
pokemon_desc_umbreon: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
pokemon_desc_murkrow: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokemon_desc_slowking: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke’s head and unlocked an extraordinary power.
pokemon_desc_misdreavus: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
pokemon_desc_unown: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
pokemon_desc_wobbuffet: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
pokemon_desc_girafarig: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
pokemon_desc_pineco: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.
pokemon_desc_forretress: It’s usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
pokemon_desc_dunsparce: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
pokemon_desc_gligar: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
pokemon_desc_steelix: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.
pokemon_desc_snubbull: It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.
pokemon_desc_granbull: While it has powerful jaws, it doesn’t care for disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display their might.
pokemon_desc_qwilfish: Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in water — it will soon attack by scattering the toxic spikes that grow all over its body.
pokemon_desc_scizor: This Pokémon’s pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.
pokemon_desc_shuckle: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
pokemon_desc_heracross: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
pokemon_desc_sneasel: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.
pokemon_desc_teddiursa: This Pokémon discreetly follows Combee to find their hive. It scoops up big dollops of honey in its palms to eat.
pokemon_desc_ursaring: It usually wears a hardened expression, but when it’s licking up honey — which it loves — the joy it feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.
pokemon_desc_slugma: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
pokemon_desc_magcargo: Magcargo’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile — just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This Pokémon returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.
pokemon_desc_swinub: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
pokemon_desc_piloswine: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.
pokemon_desc_corsola: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.
pokemon_desc_remoraid: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
pokemon_desc_octillery: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
pokemon_desc_delibird: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
pokemon_desc_mantine: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.
pokemon_desc_skarmory: The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.
pokemon_desc_houndour: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.
pokemon_desc_houndoom: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.
pokemon_desc_kingdra: With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.
pokemon_desc_phanpy: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won’t be able to settle down unless it washes its body.
pokemon_desc_donphan: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won’t faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
pokemon_desc_porygon2: This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.
pokemon_desc_stantler: This Pokémon apparently used to live in much harsher environments, and thus it once had stronger psychic powers than it does now.
pokemon_desc_smeargle: The fluid of Smeargle’s tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon’s emotions change.
pokemon_desc_tyrogue: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
pokemon_desc_hitmontop: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.
pokemon_desc_smoochum: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.
pokemon_desc_elekid: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.
pokemon_desc_magby: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
pokemon_desc_miltank: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.
pokemon_desc_blissey: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey’s egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
pokemon_desc_raikou: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
pokemon_desc_entei: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
pokemon_desc_suicune: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
pokemon_desc_larvitar: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
pokemon_desc_pupitar: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.
pokemon_desc_tyranitar: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn’t care about others.
pokemon_desc_lugia: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power — a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
pokemon_desc_ho_oh: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
pokemon_desc_celebi: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
